Events.Text: Use your imagination to generate a conversation about the topics 'checking ride status', 'getting directions', and 'schedule a meeting' (in any order), as shown on the left. You may also ask the assistant about the weather.  [instruction 1 of 6]
Hello can you help me check the status of my ride?
name
May I have your name, please?
Yes I am Ben.  My ride id is 203.

DetailedDrivingInstructions: Drive east (towards the tall brown building) on Forbes towards Murray

Your destination will be on the right just after the fire station.

Events.Text:
Unfortunately Fred is not able to make Monday @ 11 am.
Would you like to try scheduling the meeting for a different day or time?
I guess not.  Fred just puts he's busy all the time and he sits in his office playing Candy Crush.  Could you check the weather for me in Chicago on Sunday please?

PrimaryItem.Message: That person has a conflicting meeting at that time. Try another meeting time.
That person has a conflicting meeting at that time. Try another meeting time.

Events.Text: raining
It will be Raining all day on Sunday in Chicago, with temperatures of around 19 degrees celsius.
Ok that's all I needed!  Thank you so much for all your help!  Seems like you can do just about anything!
bye
Thank you and goodbye.

Scenario.UserTask:
Come up with your own scenario!

About you:
- Your name: Ben

 The AI Assistant can handle:
- Check your ride's status (e.g. ride id 203)
- Get walking/driving/transit directions (e.g. from '5th and Main' to 'Craig and Center') 
- Schedule a meeting
- Checking the weather forecast in different Cities (e.g. Chicago or Chicago)
Scenario.WizardTask: Follow the flow charts and help the user.

UserQuestionnaire.Question: Did the assistant stay calm and helpful throughout the dialogue?

WizardQuestionnaire.Question: Did the user change his/her mind about what he/she wants at any time?
Did the user become aggressive or annoyed during the dialogue? (Note: some users may be instructed to be annoying.)
Where you unsure about what to do at any time? (Feel free to send us an email with details.)
